name: QUEERZ! Chapter 1: The Jester's Last Laugh
description: A washed-up comedian spreads hate through nostalgia. Can the team save him from himself?

chapters.name: The Jester's Last Laugh
chapters.overview: The Queerz investigate harassment in NYC's Theater District, discovering Danny 'The Jester' Carbone who leads the Tough Crowd gang targeting LGBTQ+ venues.

scenes.name: Café Greenwich - The Call to Action
scenes.content: Mama Jay gathers the team at Café Greenwich with reports of escalating harassment in the Theater District. Someone calling themselves 'The Jester' is leading a group called the Tough Crowd, targeting LGBTQ+ performers and venues.

scenes.name: Theater District Investigation
scenes.content: Players investigate the Theater District, talking to performers, examining vandalized venues, and potentially encountering Tough Crowd members.

scenes.name: Moretti's Comedy Cellar - The Confrontation
scenes.content: The abandoned comedy club where Danny once performed. Players find his journal and confront him with 2-4 Tough Crowd Pawns. Can be resolved through combat or diplomacy.

innerSpace.description: Danny's Inner Space is a shabby NYC apartment frozen in the late 90s, covered with comedy posters from his glory days. A CRT TV plays his old sets on loop.

coreWounds.name: The Industry Changed
coreWounds.description: Danny feels abandoned by the comedy world when his edgy humor became unacceptable

approaches.talkItOut: The jokes didn't change - we learned who they hurt
approaches.care: Being left behind hurts. But you're hurting others now
approaches.slay: You weren't left behind - you refused to grow

coreWounds.name: The Glory Days
coreWounds.description: Manifestations of Danny's 90s success appear - clippings, awards, audience laughter - all frozen in time

approaches.talkItOut: You can't go back - but you can move forward
approaches.care: You're trying to freeze time because you're afraid
approaches.slay: That version of you caused real harm

coreWounds.name: The Real Fear
coreWounds.description: Danny's apartment walls close in. TV shows his decline - smaller venues, smaller crowds, finally just online rants

approaches.talkItOut: You can learn new ways to be funny - ways that don't hurt
approaches.care: You're more than your comedy. You're a person who can grow
approaches.slay: Then find a new way. The world doesn't owe you an audience

acceptance.description: Represents Danny accepting that he needs to change and grow
triggers: Players show compassion for his struggles

rejection.description: Represents Danny doubling down on his bitterness
triggers: No alternative offered to his worldview

outcomes.description: Danny is redeemed - breaks down crying and accepts he was wrong
consequences: Begins restorative justice at House Rainbow
Uses platform to amplify marginalized voices
outcomes.nextChapterImpact: Danny offers information about Professor Pierce, who he met at a 'concerned citizens' meeting

outcomes.description: Danny understands but isn't ready to change
consequences: Danny quietly retires from public view
Tough Crowd fractures but doesn't fully stop
Seed is planted for future growth
outcomes.nextChapterImpact: Some Tough Crowd members become recruits for Pierce's movement

outcomes.description: Danny rejects help and doubles down on nostalgia
outcomes.nextChapterImpact: Danny actively supports Pierce's movement, making Chapter 2 harder

consequences.description: Community response and character growth opportunities
rippleEffects: Theater District LGBTQ+ venues hold solidarity events
Young performers cite team as inspiration
Media coverage varies based on how public confrontation was

sessionLength.oneShot: 4-5 hours - Streamline Scene 1 (15-20 min), focus Scene 2 investigation (45-60 min), quick Scene 3 combat (30-45 min), core Inner Space moments (60-90 min)
sessionLength.twoSession: Session 1: Scenes 1-2 (3-4 hours). Session 2: Scene 3-Aftermath (3-4 hours)
sessionLength.epic: 3+ sessions - Full investigation with all optional encounters, extended Inner Space with all wounds

easier.note: Lower Danny's Ignorance Limit to 3-4, give more Story Tags from investigation, make Danny more receptive to diplomacy

harder.note: Increase Danny's Ignorance Limit to 6-7, add second Justice Knight (veteran Tough Crowd member), more complex Inner Space wounds

combatEncounters.name: Optional Tough Crowd Encounter (Scene 2)
specialMechanics: Can be resolved through TALK IT OUT or CARE
Pawns reveal meeting location if persuaded

combatEncounters.name: Danny 'The Jester' Final Confrontation
specialMechanics: Danny can summon 'hurtful punchlines' as attacks
Can be convinced to enter Inner Space with successful TALK IT OUT (10+)

npcs.name: Mama Jay Rainbow
npcs.description: Founder of House Rainbow and owner of Café Greenwich. A wise mentor figure who guides the heroes.
npcs.backstory: Former ballroom legend who opened Café Greenwich as a sanctuary for queer youth

npcs.name: Danny 'Dice' Carbone
npcs.description: Former stand-up comedian who feels left behind by changing times. Currently in civilian form.
motivations: Make people laugh like they used to
npcs.backstory: King of New York Comedy in the 90s, Danny's edgy humor became problematic. Rather than evolve, he grew bitter.

npcs.name: Danny 'The Jester'
npcs.description: Justice Knight form. Spreads 'Nostalgic Justice' through comedy that cuts and excludes.
npcs.backstory: Transformed by Ignorance into a Justice Knight embodying toxic nostalgia

moves: Hurtful Punchline - Deal emotional harm with cutting jokes
Rally the Crowd - Summon/empower Tough Crowd Pawns
That's Not Funny Anymore - Counter player moves with shame

npcs.name: Tough Crowd Pawn
npcs.description: Brainwashed follower of Danny. Working-class person infected with Nostalgic Ignorance.
npcs.backstory: Vulnerable person who found community in Danny's nostalgia-fueled movement

locations.name: Café Greenwich
locations.description: House Rainbow's headquarters. A warm, welcoming café filled with ballroom memorabilia and rainbow flags.
locations.atmosphere: Safe, warm, community-focused. Smells of coffee and fresh pastries.

locations.name: Theater District
locations.description: Mix of old and new - historic theaters alongside modern comedy clubs. Some posters defaced with 'MAKE COMEDY FUNNY AGAIN'
locations.atmosphere: Vibrant but tense. Street performers, tourists, but underlying fear from recent harassment.

locations.name: Moretti's Comedy Cellar
locations.description: Abandoned comedy club, closed for 15 years but recently active. Time capsule of 90s comedy scene.
locations.atmosphere: Dusty, nostalgic, haunting. Old posters of Danny's glory days line the walls.

checkpoints.description: Players discovered Tough Crowd connection to Danny Carbone
Players found Moretti's Comedy Cellar location
